today_in_history_posts.title: MAD-HTLC
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Weak miners are identified by their hashrate share being less than certain fee ratios.
- Non-myopic miners forego immediate fees for future rewards, affecting blockchain control dynamics.
- Myopic miners' actions can undermine non-myopic strategies, influencing bribery success and decentralization.

today_in_history_posts.title: Disclosure of a fee blackmail attack that can make a victim loose almost all funds of a non Wumbo channel and potential fixes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- In July 2019, a blackmail attack on the Lightning Network involving HTLCs was discovered.
- Implementations now limit HTLCs to mitigate potential losses from such attacks.
- Solutions include patching systems and altering HTLC handling strategies.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability aims for 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for weekly billion-user transactions.
- Proposed solutions include federated sidechains and coinpools, emphasizing security without centralization.
- Development focuses on safe, scalable operations, urging tools for Layer 1 exits and regulatory compliance.
